channel.title: Open Source Java Server [RSCD base]
channel.description:
:|
All I see on the forums these days is bickering, people arguing over who is the better "coder" (which usually means they can edit XML files more efficiently than the other person), and just general chaos. It would be great if we could develop a server that is bug free, stable, and efficient, which everyone could use. We could then design "templates", or something of the sort - variations in the configuration (XML) files, which could add to server variety.
So the question that I propose to you all is - How would you all feel about an open source/semi-open source server? By this I mean that everyone would be able to view the source code for the entire server. Work would be done by submitting changes to me, ("diffs"), which I would overlook, and then apply to the server source if they are bug free and efficient. If you submit a reasonable number of "diffs" and I can judge that you know what you are doing, I would give you "commit" access to the source code. This means you can submit the source code and apply the changes directly, without waiting for me to approve it. I would administer the project, and submit changes myself. I don't have time to develop an entire server from scratch, so the latest available version of RSCD would be used as the starting point. All work would be done using subversion as the versioning system.
Please let me know how many people are interested. It is most likely that I will make it semi-open source (have to invite people to the project to be able to view it), so it could hide from google code search.
Cheers, Vrunk

However, I’d be interested in making sprites. I did quite a bit of work on RSCD
